chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Niemczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Richard J Niemczyk in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by: Terry B., Janice N., Kenneth S.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 2 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 10 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve ONE YEAR in the House of Correction with counseling release privileges.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at ZERO.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES AND BALANCE TO BE RETURNED TO SURETY.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Psychological assessment and follow-up.
-Mental health assessment and treatment.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-Lifetime sex offender registration.
-During the first 3 years of probation perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization where children are not present.
-No contact with children under the age of 18 years unless authorized by supervising agent.
-No contact with victim, TFK (dob 4-29-2005) and her family unless authorized by supervising agent.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is remanded.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment
PSI emailed to ADA Ballenger and copy printed and provided to Atty Klimetz.

State appears by ADA Jesica Ballenger.  Defendant, Richard Niemeczyk in court with Atty Frederick Klimetz.  
AS to the AMENDED Information:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Defendant must register as sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 980 filing.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court will order a PSI and adjourn sentencing to 7-28-2015 at 8:15.

Amended Information filed by the state:
Second Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, a class C felony, 948.02(2).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
State's Notice of Intent to Use DNA filed.

Defendant Richard J Niemczyk in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
There is a joint request for another final pretrial as the DNA results have not been received yet but are expected in a week or so.  Also, the defense is requesting that the trial be adjourned from 6-15-2015 as this court has a firm multiple court case that ADA Ballenger is assigned to.
The court orders that ALL discovery be completed by 5-8-2015.  It will convert the current 6-15-15 trial date to a final pretrial and will set a new trial date of 7-6-2015.

Defendant Richard J Niemczyk in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
$7500.00 bail to be returned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
